AboutSection.title: ABOUT
AboutSection.intro: Founded in Asansol, the Mountain Lover’s Association is a community of trekkers, climbers, and nature enthusiasts dedicated to responsible mountain exploration across West Bengal and beyond. We organize training courses, guided outings, and safety workshops, and we share reliable information to help members grow their skills—from trek planning and navigation to rock climbing techniques and environmental stewardship.

missionList.item2: Build an inclusive community for beginners and experienced climbers alike
missionList.item3: Protect mountain ecosystems through awareness and action

whatDoList.item1: Skills training: rock climbing fundamentals, rope work, and safety practices
whatDoList.item2: Events and expeditions across hills and crags in the region
whatDoList.item3: Community media: trip reports, photos, and blogs
whatDoList.item4: Partnerships and knowledge-sharing with allied clubs and experts

AboutSection.closing: MLA is run by volunteers and instructors who believe mountains should be enjoyed responsibly. Join us to learn, climb, and contribute to a culture of safety and sustainability.

Newsletter.quote: Climb the mountain not to plant your flag, but to embrace the challenge, to enjoy the air and behold the view.

item1.title: EVEREST BASE CAMP TREK
item1.excerpt: As mountain guides, we are exposed to rapid and unprecedented changes in our mountain work environment due to the impact of climate change. The speed and change of intensity of earth systems events presents unprecedented risk mitigation challenges ...

item1.title: The Hidden Trails of K2
item1.excerpt: Exploring the lesser-known paths leading to K2 base camp reveals a world of untouched beauty and formidable challenges...

item2.title: Sustainability in Alpinism
item2.excerpt: How modern climbers are adopting eco-friendly practices to preserve the pristine nature of high-altitude environments for future generations.

item3.title: Gear Talk: Winter 2024 Essentials
item3.excerpt: A deep dive into the latest equipment technology keeping mountaineers safe and warm in extreme sub-zero conditions.

item4.title: Training for 8000m Peaks
item4.excerpt: Physical conditioning is just one part of the puzzle. Mental resilience and altitude acclimatization strategies are equally vital.

item5.title: Glacier Navigation 101
item5.excerpt: Understanding crevasse formation and safe route finding on dynamic glacial terrain is essential for any aspiring alpinist.

PrivacyPage.title: Privacy Policy
PrivacyPage.intro: This privacy policy sets out how Mountain Lover's Association Asansol uses and protects any information that you give us when you use this website.

section1.title: 1. Information Collection
section1.text: We may collect the following information:

list.item1: Name and contact information including email address
list.item2: Demographic information such as postcode, preferences and interests

section2.title: 2. Use of Information
section2.text: We require this information to understand your needs and provide you with a better service, and in particular for internal record keeping and improving our programs.

TermsPage.title: Terms and Conditions
TermsPage.intro: Welcome to the Mountain Lover's Association Asansol website. If you continue to browse and use this website, you are agreeing to comply with and be bound by the following terms and conditions of use.

section1.title: 1. Terms of Use
section1.text: The content of the pages of this website is for your general information and use only. It is subject to change without notice.

section2.title: 2. Membership
section2.text: Membership fees are non-refundable. Participation in mountaineering events is at your own risk.

section3.title: 3. Privacy
section3.text: Please refer to our Privacy Policy for details on how we collect and use your data.
